sen.j: 上杉禅秀の乱（うえすぎぜんしゅうのらん）とは、室町時代の1416年（応永23年）に関東地方で起こった戦乱。
sen.e: The War of Zenshu UESUGI was the war that broke out in the Kanto region in 1416, the Muromachi period.
The War of Zenshu UESUGI was the war that broke out in the Kanto region in 1416, the Muromachi period.
The War of Zenshu UESUGI was the war that broke out in the Kanto region in 1416, the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 前関東管領である上杉禅秀（禅秀）が鎌倉公方の足利持氏に対して起した反乱である。
sen.e: It was a rebellion against Mochiuji ASHIKAGA, Kamakura kubo (governor-general of the Kanto region) instigated by Ujinori (a.k.a Zenshu) UESUGI, former Kanto kanrei (assistant to Kamakura kubo).
sen.cmt: 上杉禅秀（禅秀）はウェブでは上杉氏憲（禅秀）と訂正されていましたのでそちらに合わせました。
sen.e: It was a rebellion against Mochiuji ASHIKAGA, Kamakura kubo (governor-general of the Kanto region) instigated by Ujinori (a.k.a Zenshu) UESUGI, former Kanto kanrei (assistant to Kamakura kubo).
It was a rebellion against Mochiuji ASHIKAGA, Kamakura kubo (governor-general of the Kanto region) instigated by Ujinori (a.k.a Zenshu) UESUGI, former Kanto kanrei (assistant to Kamakura kubo).

sen.j: 禅秀とは上杉氏憲の法名。
sen.e: Zenshu is the Buddhist name of Ujinori UESUGI.
Zenshu is the Buddhist name of Ujinori UESUGI.
Zenshu is the Buddhist name of Ujinori UESUGI.

sen.j: 鎌倉府は南北朝時代 (日本)に室町幕府が関東統治のために設置した機関である。
sen.e: Kamakurafu was an organization set up by the Muromachi bakufu (feudal government headed by a shogun in the Muromachi period) in order to rule the Kanto region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（日本）は訳出の必要なしと判断しました。
sen.e: Kamakurafu was an organization set up by the Muromachi bakufu (feudal government headed by a shogun in the Muromachi period) in order to rule the Kanto region in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: 「南北朝時代（日本）」を補いました。
sen.e: Kamakurafu was an organization set up by the Muromachi bakufu (feudal government headed by a shogun in the Muromachi period) in order to rule the Kanto region in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 鎌倉公方は関東管領によって補佐され、管領職は上杉氏による世襲状態であった。
sen.e: Kamakura kubo was assisted by Kanto kanrei and the post of kanrei was basically hereditary to the Uesugi clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

Kamakura kubo was assisted by Kanto kanrei, and the post of kanrei was basically hereditary to the Uesugi clan.

sen.j: 1409年（応永16）に第三代足利満兼が死去すると満兼の子の持氏が新公方となった。
sen.e: In 1409 the third shogun Mitsukane ASHIKAGA died and Mochiuji, his child, became the new kubo.
In 1409 the third shogun Mitsukane ASHIKAGA died, and Mochiuji, his child, became the new kubo.
In 1409 the third shogun Mitsukane ASHIKAGA died, and Mochiuji, his child, became the new kubo.

sen.j: 前年まで関東管領であった犬懸上杉家の上杉氏憲は前年に鎌倉公方と対立して辞職した。
sen.e: Ujinori UESUGI (from the Inukake Uesugi family), who had been Kanto kanrei, had resigned in opposition to the Kamakura kubo the previous year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処分かりやすさのため、一部を括弧に入れました。
sen.e: Ujinori UESUGI (from the Inukake Uesugi family), who had been Kanto kanrei, had resigned in opposition to the Kamakura kubo the previous year.
Ujinori UESUGI (from the Inukake Uesugi family), who had been Kanto kanrei, had resigned in opposition to the Kamakura kubo the previous year.

sen.j: 後任の管領に犬懸上杉家と対立関係にあった山内上杉家の上杉憲基が管領職に付く。
sen.e: Subsequently Norimoto UESUGI (from the Yamanouchi Uesugi family, a rival of the Inukake Uesugi family) succeeded Ujinori in the kanrei post.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処分かりやすさのため、一部を括弧に入れました。
sen.e: Subsequently Norimoto UESUGI (from the Yamanouchi Uesugi family, a rival of the Inukake Uesugi family) succeeded the kanrei post.
sen.cmt: Ujinori in を削除しました。
sen.e: Subsequently Norimoto UESUGI (from the Yamanouchi Uesugi family, a rival of the Inukake Uesugi family) succeeded the kanrei post.

sen.j: すると持氏の叔父にあたる足利満隆、満隆の養子で持氏の弟である足利持仲らと接近し、氏憲の婿にあたる岩松満純、長尾氏春、千葉氏、宇都宮氏、小田氏、相模三浦氏、武田氏や地方の国人衆なども加えて1416年に持氏に対して反乱する。
sen.e: Ujinori then approached Mitsutaka ASHIKAGA (Mochiuji's uncle) and Mochinaka ASHIKAGA (adopted child of Mitsutaka and younger brother of Mochiuji), also won Mitsuzumi IWAMATSU (Ujinori's son in-law), Ujiharu NAGAO, the Chiba clan, the Utsunomiya clan, the Oda clan, the Sagami Miura clan, the Takeda clan and Kokujin-shu (local samurai) over to his side and revolted against Mochiuji in 1416.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処分かりやすさのため、一部を括弧に入れました。
sen.e: Ujinori then approached Mitsutaka ASHIKAGA (Mochiuji's uncle) and Mochinaka ASHIKAGA (adopted child of Mitsutaka and younger brother of Mochiuji), also gained Mitsuzumi IWAMATSU (Ujinori's son in-law), Ujiharu NAGAO, the Chiba clan, the Utsunomiya clan, the Oda clan, the Sagami Miura clan, the Takeda clan and Kokujin-shu (local samurai) over to his side and revolted against Mochiuji in 1416.

Ujinori then approached Mitsutaka ASHIKAGA (Mochiuji's uncle) and Mochinaka ASHIKAGA (adopted child of Mitsutaka and younger brother of Mochiuji), also gained Mitsuzumi IWAMATSU (Ujinori's son in-law), Ujiharu NAGAO, the Chiba clan, the Utsunomiya clan, the Oda clan, the Sagami Miura clan, the Takeda clan and Kokujin-shu (local samurai) over to his side and revolted against Mochiuji in 1416.

sen.j: 応永23年10月2日の戌の刻頃、足利満隆が御所近くの宝寿院に入り挙兵した。
sen.e: On October 31, 1416 around Dog Time (8.00-10.00pm) Mitsutaka ASHIKAGA entered Hoju-in Temple near Mochiuji's residence and took up arms.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処戌の刻：定訳不明舞台は鎌倉なので、ここでの御所は皇居ではなく、貴人の邸宅の意味に取り、持氏の邸宅と解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: On October 31, 1416 around Dog Time (8:00 - 10:00 pm), Mitsutaka ASHIKAGA entered Hoju-in Temple near Kamakura Gosho (Mochiuji's residence) and took up arms.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。カンマを補いました。Kamakura Gosho (Mochiuji's residence) と補強しました。
sen.e: On October 31, 1416 around Dog Time (8:00 - 10:00 pm), Mitsutaka ASHIKAGA entered Hoju-in Temple near Kamakura Gosho (Mochiuji's residence) and took up arms.

sen.j: 氏憲とともに持氏・憲基拘束に向かうが持氏らは家臣に連れられて脱出していた（『鎌倉大草紙』）。
sen.e: Mitsutaka together with Ujinori went to capture Mochiuji and Norimoto, however Mochiuji and others had already escaped led by their retainers (according to "Kamakura Ozoshi").
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Mitsutaka together with Ujinori went to capture Mochiuji and Norimoto, however Mochiuji and others had already escaped led by their retainers (according to "Kamakura Ozoshi").
Mitsutaka together with Ujinori went to capture Mochiuji and Norimoto, however Mochiuji and others had already escaped led by their retainers (according to "Kamakura Ozoshi").

sen.j: その後、氏憲と満隆は合流した諸氏の兵とともに鎌倉を制圧下に置いた。
sen.e: After that Ujinori and Mitsutaka took control of Kamakura together with soldiers recruited from various families.
After that, Ujinori and Mitsutaka took control of Kamakura together with the soldiers recruited from various clans.
sen.cmt: カンマ、the を補いました。families→clans と修正しました。
sen.e: After that, Ujinori and Mitsutaka took control of Kamakura together with the soldiers recruited from various clans.

sen.j: 今川範政を頼り駿河へ逃れた持氏は幕府の援助を受けた。
sen.e: Mochiuji, who escaped to Suruga expecting the protection of Norimasa IMAGAWA, was supported by the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Mochiuji, who escaped to Suruga expecting the protection of Norimasa IMAGAWA, was supported by the bakufu.
Mochiuji, who escaped to Suruga expecting the protection of Norimasa IMAGAWA, was supported by the bakufu.

sen.j: 幕府の命を受けた今川氏・越後上杉氏・佐竹氏・宇都宮氏の兵が満隆・氏憲討伐に向かった。
sen.e: The soldiers of the Imagawa clan, the Echigo Uesugi clan, the Satake clan and the Utsunomiya clan went to subdue Mitsutaka and Ujinori on the orders of the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The soldiers of the Imagawa clan, the Echigo Uesugi clan, the Satake clan and the Utsunomiya clan went to subdue Mitsutaka and Ujinori on the order of the bakufu.
The soldiers of the Imagawa clan, the Echigo Uesugi clan, the Satake clan and the Utsunomiya clan went to subdue Mitsutaka and Ujinori on the order of the bakufu.

sen.j: このため、氏憲らは駿河を攻めるが今川氏に敗れる。
sen.e: Consequently Ujinori and others attacked Suruga Province but they were defeated by the Imagawa clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Consequently Ujinori and others attacked Suruga Province but they were defeated by the Imagawa clan.

sen.j: 更に上杉氏らに押された江戸氏・豊島氏ら武蔵の武士団が呼応して武蔵から氏憲勢力を排除した。
sen.e: Further the samurai group in Musashi Province consisting of the Edo clan and the Toshima clan were provoked by the Uesugi clan, and when they reacted to this they expelled the force of Ujinori from Musashi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore the samurai group pushed by the Uesugi clan and others, including the Edo clan and the Toshima clan in Musashi Province, hailed each other and expelled the force of Ujinori from Musashi.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Furthermore the samurai group pushed by the Uesugi clan and others, including the Edo clan and the Toshima clan in Musashi Province, hailed each other and expelled the force of Ujinori from Musashi.

sen.j: 翌応永24年元日の世谷原の戦いで氏憲軍が江戸・豊島連合軍を破り、押し返す。
sen.e: In the following year, 1417 Ujinori's troops rallied as they defeated the united force of the Edo and Toshima clans.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the following year of 1417, the Battle of Seyahara on the New Year's Day, Ujinori's troops rallied as they defeated the united force of the Edo and Toshima clans.

sen.j: しかしその間隙を突いて今川軍が相模に侵攻、1月10日に氏憲や満隆、持仲らが鎌倉雪ノ下で自害した事で収束した。
sen.e: However the Imagawa army invaded the Sagami region at an unguarded moment and the clash was brought to an end by the suicide of Ujinori, Mitsutaka, Mochinaka and so on in Yukinoshita, Kamakura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However the Imagawa army invaded the Sagami region at an unguarded moment, and the clash was brought to an end on February 5, by the suicide of Ujinori, Mitsutaka, Mochinaka and others in Yukinoshita, Kamakura.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。「1月10日」を補いました。応永24年1月10日→西暦1417年2月5日としました。so on→others と修正しました。
sen.e: However the Imagawa army invaded the Sagami region at an unguarded moment, and the clash was brought to an end on February 5, by the suicide of Ujinori, Mitsutaka, Mochinaka and others in Yukinoshita, Kamakura.

sen.j: また、乱で敗北した事により犬懸上杉氏は滅亡した。
sen.e: Their defeat in the battle led to the destruction of the Inukake Uesugi clan being wiped out.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Their defeat in the battle led the Inukake Uesugi clan to die out.

sen.e: Their defeat in the battle led the Inukake Uesugi clan to die out.

sen.j: （ただし、氏憲の子の何人かは出家することにより存命し、幕府の庇護を受けている）。
sen.e: However some of Ujinori's children survived by entering the priesthood where they were put under the patronage of the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（）は除きました。

sen.j: また、岩松満純・武田信満は追討軍によって討たれた。
sen.e: Also Mitsuzumi IWAMATSU and Nobumitsu TAKEDA were captured and killed by a search-and-destroy troop.
Also Mitsuzumi IWAMATSU and Nobumitsu TAKEDA were killed by a search-and-destroy troop.

sen.j: 禅秀の乱の波紋
sen.e: The effects of the War of Zenshu
The effects of the War of Zenshu
The effects of the War of Zenshu

sen.j: 室町幕府では乱に際して4代将軍の足利義持は持氏を支援した。
sen.e: The fourth Shogun of the Muromachi bakufu, Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA, supported Mochiuji in the war.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The fourth Shogun of the Muromachi bakufu, Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA, supported Mochiuji in the war.
The fourth Shogun of the Muromachi bakufu, Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA, supported Mochiuji in the war.

sen.j: しかし一方では義持の弟の足利義嗣が出奔する事件が起こり、義嗣は捕縛されて幽閉される。
sen.e: There was the incident of Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA, who was the younger brother of Yoshimochi, running away and leading to Yoshitsugu's capture and confinement.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There was the incident of Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA, who was the younger brother of Yoshimochi, running away and leading to Yoshitsugu's capture and confinement.
There was the incident of Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA, who was the younger brother of Yoshimochi, running away and leading to Yoshitsugu's capture and confinement.

sen.j: 幕府内で上杉氏憲と内通してたと疑惑を持たれる人物の名前があがるなど波紋が広がる。
sen.e: It caused such a stir that the name of the person suspected to have secretly communicated with Ujinori UESUGI inside the bakufu was made public.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It caused such a stir that the name of the person suspected to have secretly communicated with Ujinori UESUGI inside the bakufu was mentioned.

sen.e: It caused such a stir that the name of the person suspected to have secretly communicated with Ujinori UESUGI inside the bakufu was mentioned.

sen.j: 1417年（応永24年）、氏憲の死後に自分の身に対する危険を感じた足利義嗣は京都を脱出する。
sen.e: Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA, who feared for his safety after the death of Ujinori, escaped from Kyoto in 1417.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA, who feared for his safety after the death of Ujinori, escaped from Kyoto in 1417.
Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA, who feared for his safety after the death of Ujinori, escaped from Kyoto in 1417.

sen.j: しかし間もなく義持側近であった富樫満成に高雄 (京都市)で捕らえられた。
sen.e: However he was soon captured in Takao (Kyoto City) by Mitsunari TOGASHI, an attendant to Yoshimochi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However he was soon captured in Takao (Kyoto City) by Mitsunari TOGASHI, a close attendant to Yoshimochi.
sen.cmt: an attendant→a close attendant と修正しました。
sen.e: However he was soon captured in Takao (Kyoto City) by Mitsunari TOGASHI, a close attendant to Yoshimochi.

sen.j: 義嗣の身柄は仁和寺から相国寺へ幽閉されて10月20日に出家させられた。
sen.e: Yoshitsugu was moved from Ninna-ji Temple and held in Shokoku-ji Temple, and on October 20 (old calendar) was forced to enter the priesthood
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処応永24年10月20日は西暦1417年12月7日ですが、次のセルの「11月に入ると」をグレゴリオ暦にするとそちらも12月になるため、旧暦のままとして(old calendar)と付け加えました。
sen.e: Yoshitsugu was moved from Ninna-ji Temple and confined in Shokoku-ji Temple, and on October 20 (old calendar) was forced to enter the priesthood.
sen.cmt: held→confined と修正しました。ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: Yoshitsugu was moved from Ninna-ji Temple and confined in Shokoku-ji Temple, and on October 20 (old calendar) was forced to enter the priesthood.

sen.j: ところが、11月に入ると義嗣の取調べにあたった富樫満成から出された報告が問題を呼んだ。
sen.e: However in November (old calendar) the report from Mitsunari TOGASHI, Yoshitsugu's interrogator, caused a problem.
sen.cmt: 「11月」はグレゴリオ暦にすると12月になりますが、上のセルとの兼ね合いでこちらも旧暦のままとして(old calendar)と付け加えました。
sen.e: However in November (old calendar) the report from Mitsunari TOGASHI, Yoshitsugu's interrogator, caused a problem.
However in November (old calendar) the report from Mitsunari TOGASHI, Yoshitsugu's interrogator, caused a problem.

sen.j: そこには義嗣とともに現管領細川満元、元管領斯波義教をはじめ、畠山満慶、赤松義則、土岐康政、山名時熙、更に公家の山科教高、日野持光らが共謀して上杉氏憲に呼応して義持打倒を計画していたと言うのである。
sen.e: The report said that together with Yoshitsugu, including the present kanrei, Mitsumoto HOSOKAWA and a former kanrei Yoshinori SHIBA, Mitsunori HATAKEYAMA, Yoshinori AKAMATSU, Yasumasa TOKI, Tokihiro YAMANA and further the court nobles such as Noritaka YAMASHINA and Mochimitsu HINO conspired and plotted to overthrow Yoshimochi working together with Ujinori UESUGI..

The report said that together with Yoshitsugu, there were the present kanrei, Mitsumoto HOSOKAWA and a former kanrei Yoshinori SHIBA, Mitsunori HATAKEYAMA, Yoshinori AKAMATSU, Yasumasa TOKI, Tokihiro YAMANA and also the court nobles such as Noritaka YAMASHINA and Mochimitsu HINO conspired and plotted to overthrow Yoshimochi working together with Ujinori UESUGI..

sen.e: The report said that together with Yoshitsugu, there were the present kanrei, Mitsumoto HOSOKAWA and a former kanrei Yoshinori SHIBA, Mitsunori HATAKEYAMA, Yoshinori AKAMATSU, Yasumasa TOKI, Tokihiro YAMANA and also the court nobles such as Noritaka YAMASHINA and Mochimitsu HINO conspired and plotted to overthrow Yoshimochi working together with Ujinori UESUGI..

sen.j: これを受けて土岐持頼（康政の嫡子）が伊勢国守護の地位を奪われた。
sen.e: In response to the report, Mochiyori TOKI (Yasumasa's legitimate child) was removed from his position as shugo of Ise Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In response to the report, Mochiyori TOKI (Yasumasa's legitimate child) was removed from his position as shugo of Ise Province.
In response to the report, Mochiyori TOKI (Yasumasa's legitimate child) was removed from his position as shugo of Ise Province.

sen.j: 他、満元以下有力守護や公家たちが揃って謹慎・配流を命じられたのである。
sen.e: Also dominant shugo (military governors) including Mitsumoto and others, and court nobles, were all either put under house arrest or exiled.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also dominant shugo (military governors) including Mitsumoto and others, and court nobles, were all either put under house arrest or exiled.
Also dominant shugo (military governors) including Mitsumoto and others, and court nobles, were all either put under house arrest or exiled.

sen.j: 明けて1418年（応永25年）に入ると、義嗣は義持の命を受けた富樫満成により殺害される。
sen.e: In the following year, 1418, Yoshitsugu was killed by Mitsunari TOGASHI on the orders of Yoshimochi.
In the following year, 1418, Yoshitsugu was killed by Mitsunari TOGASHI on the order of Yoshimochi.
In the following year, 1418, Yoshitsugu was killed by Mitsunari TOGASHI on the order of Yoshimochi.

sen.j: ところが、この年の11月には逆に富樫満成が義嗣に加担し、なおかつ義持の妻妾・林歌局と密通しているとの疑いで追放されてしまったのである。
sen.e: However in November of that year Mitsunari TOGASHI was himself under suspicion, that he had assisted Yoshitsugu and also committed adultery with Yoshimochi's wife, 林歌局 and for this he was expelled.
However, in November of that year, Mitsunari TOGASHI was himself under suspicion, that he had assisted Yoshitsugu and also committed adultery with Yoshimochi's wife, 林歌局 and for this he was expelled.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。ここでの「11月」が旧暦を指すのか西暦を指すのかが判りません。（ここではそのままにしております）また、「妻妾・林歌局」の部分なのですが、”妻妾＝妻とめかけ”であり、ここでの意味合いにずれが生じるように思うのですが。ただし、ここではこのままにしております。「林歌局」の読みは確認出来ておりません。
sen.e: However, in November of that year, Mitsunari TOGASHI was himself under suspicion, that he had assisted Yoshitsugu and also committed adultery with Yoshimochi's wife, 林歌局 and for this he was expelled.

sen.j: これは件の告発によって義持と富樫満成ら側近集団に実権を奪われた細川以下の有力守護大名側の逆クーデターとも言われている。
sen.e: Some consider that this was a counter-coup by dominant shugo guardian feudal lords, HOSOKAWA amongst others, who were disempowered following the accusations of Yoshimochi and a group of his attendants, including Mitsunari TOGASHI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.e: Some consider that this was a counter-coup by dominant shugo guardian feudal lords, Hosokawa amongst others, who were disempowered following the accusations of Yoshimochi and a group of his attendants, including Mitsunari TOGASHI.

sen.j: （富樫満成がかけられた義持妻妾との密通容疑は後に別件で失脚した同じく義持側近の赤松持貞に対しても容疑としてかけられたものであった。）
sen.e: Both Mitsunari TOGASHI and Mochisada AKAMATSU, attendants of Yoshimochi, were accused of adultery with a wife of Yoshimochi, and AKAMATSU received his downfall related to another case at a later date.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（）は除きました。
sen.e: (Both Mitsunari TOGASHI and Mochisada AKAMATSU, close attendants of Yoshimochi, were accused of adultery with a wife of Yoshimochi, and AKAMATSU received his downfall related to another case later.)

sen.j: なお、富樫満成は高野山に逃亡したものの、1419年2月28日（応永26年2月4日）に畠山満家の討伐によって殺害されている。
sen.e: Mitsunari TOGASHI fled to Mt. Koya but was captured and killed by Mitsuie HATAKEYAMA on February 28, 1419.

sen.e: The viewpoint of the Muromachi bakufu was that they took the step of killing Ujinori because of their fear of his coalition with Yoshitsugu and the Southern Court.

sen.j: 持氏も幕府中央の混乱に乗じて関東・奥州各地に発生した武装蜂起に対して自己の政権の権限と基盤の強化に乗り出して幕府中央の権威を否定する動きを以前から見せていたからである。
sen.e: This is because Mochiuji also had started to deny the authority of the central bakufu by strengthening the power and basis of his regime against the armed uprisings which were breaking out in various areas in Kanto and Oshu regions during the confusion of the central bakufu.

sen.e: There is the case of the bereaved child of Ujinori, who was believed to have been hunted down and killed by the bakufu, but who had actually been protected by the bakufu.

sen.j: 禅秀の死の翌年にはその旧領であった上総国において上総本一揆と呼ばれる旧臣である国人達を中心とした一揆が発生している。
sen.e: In the year after Zenshu's death, the uprising called 'Kazusa no Hanikki' led by his former retainers, the local lords, broke out in Kazusa Province, one of Zenshu's feudal estates.

sen.j: その後、持氏は岩松氏や佐竹氏（山入氏系）などの氏憲の残党狩りや京都扶持衆の大名など関東における反対勢力の粛清などを行う。
sen.e: After that Mochiuji hunted the remaining attendants of Ujinori, including the Iwamatsu clan and the Satake clan (originating from the Yamairi clan), and purged opponents in Kanto region including territorial lords belonging to Kyoto fuchishu (samurai in Kanto and Tohoku regions who were direct vassals of Shogun).
